ygData.subject: Re: Still kinda dense on specialization, sorry.
ygData.msgSnippet: It is? Hrm I could of swore buffing was alteration as well.  I ll have to re-check my lists. Mr. J Daniels
ygData.messageBody:
It is? Hrm I could of swore buffing was alteration as well. I'll have to
re-check my lists.

Mr. J Daniels


On Wed, 30 Jun 1999 errors-200561-243-warpig=one.net@onelist.com wrote:

> From: I.G <shadowtg1@...>
>
> healing is alteration but buffing is abjuradation.
>
> Jaxim
>
>
> >From: "Dan Harmon" <deharmon@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> >To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> >Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Still kinda dense on specialization, sorry.
> >Date: Wed, 30 Jun 1999 09:44:09 -0400
> >
> >From: "Dan Harmon" <deharmon@...>
> >
> >I understand what it is, but have a couple questions.
> >
> >I'm a lvl 13. All my casting is at lvl65. If I understand it correctly, I
> >can't even specialize until lvl 30, right? By that time ALL my magic skill
> >levels will be at 150.
> >
> >So if I specialize (I believe alteration IS the healing/buffing one) at lvl
> >30, what happens? I'm thinking that my alteration will continue to go up,
> >but the other 3 or 4 will suddenly take a 100 level dive back to lvl 50?
> >
> >I'm not bitching, I just haven't decided whether or not I want to do it.
> >Thank god it'll take me a minimum of 2 more months before I get to lvl 30 &
> >apparently have to worry about making that decision. :)
> >
